content.description: <math alttext="S O 2 gas plus C l 2 gas is in equilibrium with S O 2 C l 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>⇄</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: <math alttext="S O 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> reacts with <math alttext="C l 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> to produce <math alttext="S O 2 C l 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, according to the equation above. A mixture of <math alttext="1.00 atmosphere" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="S O 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="1.00 atmosphere" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="C l 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is placed in a rigid, evacuated <math alttext="1.00 liter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> container, and the reaction mixture is allowed to reach equilibrium at a certain temperature. The table below shows the initial partial pressure of each gas and the equilibrium partial pressures of <math alttext="S O 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="S O 2 C l 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> at the same temperature. <math alttext="P sub S O 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></msub></mrow></math> <math alttext="P sub C l 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></msub></mrow></math> <math alttext="P sub S O 2 C l 2" Initial pressure <math alttext="atmospheres" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(atm)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 1.00 1.00 0.00 Equilibrium pressure <math alttext="atmospheres" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(atm)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 0.20 <math alttext="question mark" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>?</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> 0.80 Which of the following indicates the equilibrium value of <math alttext="P sub C l 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and the approximate value of the equilibrium constant, <math alttext="K sub p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="P sub C l 2 equals 0.10 atmosphere" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.10</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="K sub p equals 5.0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>5.0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="P sub C l 2 equals 0.20 atmosphere" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.20</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="K sub p equals 0.050" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.050</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="P sub C l 2 equals 0.80 atmosphere" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.80</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="K sub p equals 0.025" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.025</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.C: Explain the relationship between variables within an equation when one variable changes.
